main.commit_message:
Small lexical fixes in CMakeLists.txt

Signed-off-by: Klaus Kämpf <kkaempf@suse.de>

openwsman: OpenWsmanClient: add AllowSelfSignedServerCert method

Co-authored-by: Katz, Nechama <nechama.katz@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Debel, Erel <erel.debel@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsmc_handler: clear previous flags if not verifying host or peer

Co-authored-by: Katz, Nechama <nechama.katz@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Debel, Erel <erel.debel@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

Cleanup lock/unlock in xml serializer

Signed-off-by: Klaus Kämpf <kkaempf@suse.de>

openwsman: wsman-soap-envelope: initilize enum variable with enum value

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap-envelope: drop unused assignment

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: drop unused assignment

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-xml-serialize: fix lock initialize

Pass lock variable into initialize function, not the whole object.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap: avoid double lock

ws_remove_context_val takes context lock.
Do not lock it in caller.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-libxml2-binding: check strdup for NULL

Check strdup result to avoid NULL dereference.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-filter: check alloc result

Check alloc result for NULL and bail out top avoid NULL dereference.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-epr: move variables to the beginning of function

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-dispatcher: ensure that buf is not NULL

ensure that buf is not NULL before using it

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: check result of alloc

Avoid NULL-dereference by chekcing result of alloc.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: drop unused assignment

node is not used after assignment.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: drop second node null-check

The node variable checked for NULL couple of linse above.
Drop not needed second check.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: drop null check before u_uri_free

u_uri_free checks it parameter  - no need to check twice.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: fix call to u_uri_parse

No need to allocate uri struct as u_uri_parse allocates it.
The struct allocated outside is leaked.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: use enum values instead of plain one for enum variables

Impeove code readability by using values from enum instead of
plane integers in enum variables.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: uoption: fix code offset

Improve code readability by fixing code block offset.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: pthreadx_win32: fix variable type

_beginthreadex required unsigned int parameter, not DWORD.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: protect classes from self-assignment

Do not copy data if object is self-assigned.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: OpenWsmanClient: drop unused XmlDocToString

XmlDocToString function is unused, remove it.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: OpenWsmanClient: remove unused function declaration

SetOptions is forward-declared but does not exists and not used.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: cleanup serializer

Cleanup serializer in client release.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: error out on failed strdup

Bail out if strdup failed.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: error out on failed alloc

Check results of alloc/strdup and bail out with error if it failed.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: initilize pointer

Initialize pointer to null for the case where ws_xml_dump_memory_node_tree
do not initilize it.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: check for alloc failure

Avoid NULL derefernce.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-client: check for strdup failures

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: uri: bail out on alloc failure

Avoid NULL-dereferencing by bailing out on failed malloc.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap: clean leak in error path

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-win-client-transport: remove unused Auth2Scheme

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-win-client-transport: use char for cert valiation

Certificate parameters should be always char.
Replace _TCHAR with CHAR and use CertGetNameStringA.
Drop const from one of parameters as target function also has no const
there.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap: check result of lnode_create

Bail out if lnode_create failed.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap: drop unused variable

Drop unused data variable.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap: fix alloc size

Alloc struct size, not the pointer size.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-soap-envelope: unshadow variable

Rename index variable that shadows function parameter.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

Signed-off-by: Klaus Kämpf <kkaempf@suse.de>

add more runtime options to allow running from build directory

This commit adds the following options when calling openwsmand:

  -a, --auth-dir=<directory>                      Authentication plugin dir (testing)
  -b, --basic-password-file=<file>                Basic password file (testing)
  -P, --plugin-dir=<directory>                    Dispatcher plugins directory (testing)

This enables running (and testing) openwsmand without the need to
install it in its final destination.

Fixes #163

update ChangeLog

Signed-off-by: Klaus Kämpf <kkaempf@suse.de>

openwsman: wsman-client: add NULL checks

Bail out if service functions return NULL pointers
to avoid NULL dereference.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-win-client-transport: initialize certificate pointer

Initialize the certificate pointer to NULL to avoid
warnings about uninitilized variable usage that became
errors with new Visual Studio.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: iniparser: fix buffer size

Account for column size in buffer.

Fix gcc warning:
openwsman/src/lib/u/iniparser.c: In function ‘iniparser_new’:
openwsman/src/lib/u/iniparser.c:503:50: warning: ‘__builtin___snprintf_chk’ output may be truncated before the last format character [-Wformat-truncation=]
  503 |         snprintf(longkey, sizeof(longkey), "%s:%s", sec, key);
      |                                                  ^
In file included from /usr/include/stdio.h:867,
                 from openwsman/src/lib/u/iniparser.c:31:
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/stdio2.h:67:10: note: ‘__builtin___snprintf_chk’ output between 2 and 2050 bytes into a destination of size 2049

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: wsman-win-client-transport: plug leak in error path

Free allocated memory in error path.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

fix comments

Signed-off-by: Klaus Kämpf <kkaempf@suse.de>

Improve handling of HTTP 401 Unauthorized

The wsmancli returns an error immediately after receiving
an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response.
The handling of authentication should be improved to better
conform to RFC 2616.

Author of the patch:
Thomas Derr (DFS Deutsche Flugsicherung GmbH, https://www.dfs.de/)
New release 2.7.1

Bump cmake_minimum_required to 2.8.12

This is what CMAKE 3.19 requires
Add README.testing
Add Chris' stress-test script

Make the client build with MingW

Modify the ifdefs so that the client can be built.
This was tested on Fedora with Autotools and
mingw64-configure CFLAGS=-std=c99 --disable-server --disable-eventing --disable-pam

Signed-off-by: Bastian Germann <bastiangermann@fishpost.de>

Replace date formats unavailable for MingW

MingW does not have %e and %T formatters, so replace them.
%e is replaced by %d which has leading zeros.

Signed-off-by: Bastian Germann <bastiangermann@fishpost.de>

Hide wsmc_get_conffile behind _WIN32 (like prototype)

Signed-off-by: Bastian Germann <bastiangermann@fishpost.de>

Add missing prototype wsmc_set_selectors_from_uri

Signed-off-by: Bastian Germann <bastiangermann@fishpost.de>

Prevent unused-const-variable errors for rcsid

Signed-off-by: Bastian Germann <bastiangermann@fishpost.de>

Replace bzero with memset

Signed-off-by: Bastian Germann <bastiangermann@fishpost.de>

openwsman: fix msvc cmake

Fix syntax errors that merge produces.

Fixes: d7cc604a (openwsman: cmake: eliminate some warnings in msvc build)
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: cleanup password after use

Secure cleanup connection and proxy passwords after the last use to
eliminate possibility of password leak on memory release.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: cmake: pull libxml2 definitions

LibXML2 defines LIBXML_STATIC if compiled statically.
Allow OpenWsman to build with static LibXML2 by pulling
compile flags from LibXML2 package config.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: set right type of NULL parameter

Convert the NULL pointer to HCRYPTPROV_LEGACY to eliminate warning:
warning C4047: 'function': 'HCRYPTPROV_LEGACY' differs in levels of indirection from 'void *'

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: ifdef weak pragma while compiling with MSVC

MSVC have no notion about "pragma weak".
Ifdef such pragmas to eliminate warnings like:
warning C4068: unknown pragma

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: CMake: ignore Microsoft deprecations

Add _CRT_NONSTDC_NO_DEPRECATE compile flag to ignore warnings like:
warning C4996: 'strdup': The POSIX name for this item
is deprecated. Instead, use the ISO C and C++ conformant name: _strdup.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: add underscore before warning and info macro

The warning and info are too generic names.
Warning now collides with #pragma warning(push) MSVC usage.
Add underscore before macro names to fix such collisions.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: cmake: eliminate some warnings in msvc build

Put MSVC-specific compile flags in case of such compiler detected.
Add _CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS compile definition to hide
Microsoft deprecation warnings that cannot be resolved in the
cross-compiled code.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>
drop RANDFILE, openssl 1.1.1 borks on it
make source code backwards compatible to older GCC versions

wsman-soap-envelope: fix potential NULL pointer dereference

Bail out if strdup failed.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>
split off client libraries as separate package: libwsman_client5
Update to 2.6.13
fix syntax error
update ChangeLog
update ChangeLog to 2.7.0
update ChangeLog to 2.6.13
Version 2.7.0, libwsman_client.so.5

WsmanClient: add ability to pass options flags to Get and Put

Add flags parameter to Get and Put methods of WsmanClient
to allow to pass flags to call options.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: add flag to options for 100-continue supression

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-curl-client-transport: supress 100-continue

Supress 100-continue if such requested by client flag.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: check existance of delivery_username

Check existance of delivery_username instead of check
for delivery_password twice.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: fix trivial spelling errors

Fix trivial spelling errors, mostly in comments and debug
messages.

Signed-off-by: Tomas Winkler <tomas.winkler@intel.com>

Add option to compile with msvc static runtime

MSVC by default links against dynamic runtime library,
add option to link against static runtime.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>
client_opt: expiry and hearbeat_interval are float

wsman-soap-envelope: fix wsman_get_selector definition

Drop unneded const to eliminate warning:
openwsman\src\lib\wsman-soap-envelope.c(1283): warning C4028: formal parameter 4 different from declaration

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: fix parameter type in api

Fix warnings like:
openwsman\src\lib\wsman-client.c(653): warning C4244: '=': conversion from 'int' to 'float', possible loss of data

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

pthreadx: add pthread_mutexattr_destroy to header

Fixes warning on MSVC build:
openwsman\src\lib\u\lock.c(64): warning C4013: 'pthread_mutexattr_destroy' undefined; assuming extern returning int

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-epr: fix signed/unsigned mismatch

Fix warnings like:
openwsman\src\lib\wsman-epr.c(103): warning C4018: '<': signed/unsigned mismatch

Fix bogus whitespacing too.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-xml-serialize: check parsed time for validity

Protect library from rouge input by checking that
received time values ares inside the standard bounds:
https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007908799/xsh/time.h.html

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: fix action options accessors

flags variable is unsigned long, but all accessors are unsigned int.
Update accessors to unsigned long to eliminate type size
incompatibility problems.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: account for null options and remove duplicate null check

Fix one more place where options pointer can be NULL.
Remove duplicated NULL check (seems like a merge problem).

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-soap-envelope: Check right variable for NULL

Wrong variable was checked for NULL: node instead of object.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-soap: account for NULL from ws_xml_get_node_text

Bail early if ws_xml_get_node_text returns NULL.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: bool type is not recognized by visual studio

Visual Studio does not recognize bool in c code by default.
Fix Windows build by moving stdbool.h out of #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H guard.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

debug: fix for a possible NULL dereferencing

Check results of allocations and list operations for NULL.

Signed-off-by: Vitaly Lubart <vitaly.lubart@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

OpenWsmanClient: restore accidentally dropped string

Restore a string in the error message accidentally dropped in
commit aa78f73d21ba ("OpenWsmanClient: replace sprintf with stringstream")

Fixes: aa78f73d21ba ("OpenWsmanClient: replace sprintf with stringstream")
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>
DeprecationWarning: Please use assertEqual instead.

wsman-libxml2-binding: drop never executed free

doc is always NULL in this branch, so it's noop

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: don't compare enumInfo->index to >= 0

enumInfo->index and enumInfo->totalItems are unsigned integer,
are always always a postive number.
Fix -Wtautological-compare

Signed-off-by: Tomas Winkler <tomas.winkler@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-open: initialize status prior to first goto

Need to call wsman_status_init(&status) prior to first bail out to DONE
so the fault_msg is initialized.

Signed-off-by: Tomas Winkler <tomas.winkler@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: fix warnings in shttpd

CIM_Framework/openwsman/src/server/shttpd/io_emb.c:309:48: warning: 'memcpy' call operates on objects of type 'const struct conn' while the size is based on a different type 'const struct conn *' [-Wsizeof-pointer-memaccess]
       (void) memcpy(buf + sizeof(cmd), conn, sizeof(conn));
                                        ~~~~         ^~~~
CIM_Framework/openwsman/src/server/shttpd/io_emb.c:309:48: note: did you mean to dereference the argument to 'sizeof' (and multiply it by the number of elements)?
       (void) memcpy(buf + sizeof(cmd), conn, sizeof(conn));

CIM_Framework/openwsman/src/server/shttpd/auth.c:235:22: warning: for loop has empty body [-Wempty-body]
           s++, ha1->len++);
                           ^
CIM_Framework/openwsman/src/server/shttpd/auth.c:235:22: note: put the semicolon on a separate line to silence this warning

Signed-off-by: Tomas Winkler <tomas.winkler@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: add static where needed

Add static qualifier to set proper scoping of the function and variables.

Signed-off-by: Tomas Winkler <tomas.winkler@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-filter: fix signed/unsigned mismatch

Fix warnings like:

/work/gitlab/openwsman/src/lib/wsman-filter.c: In function ‘_filter_add_selector’:
/work/gitlab/openwsman/src/lib/wsman-filter.c:169:15: warning: comparison between signed and unsigned integer expressions [-Wsign-compare]
  for(i = 0; i < filter->selectorset.count; i++) {

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsmand-listener: exit flow if gss_encrypt fail

Exit flow if gss_encrypt fail, otherwise we'll use
potentially uninitialized variables.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-client: set selectors to NULL to allow reuse

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

WsmanOptions: Add check for NULL pointer in WsmanOptions

Throw exception to avoiud NULL pointer dereference in future.

Signed-off-by: Vitaly Lubart <vitaly.lubart@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-soap-envelope: fix compilation error

Use include "u/gettimeofday.h" instead of <sys/time.h>
to have definition of gettimeofday function for every platform.

Signed-off-by: Tomas Winkler <tomas.winkler@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

define ASCIILINESZ only once

add a comment to adapt scanf() %1024 usage to the actual ASCIILINESZ value

iniparser: fix sscanf issues

Instruct sscanf about maximum size of receiving buffer to
eliminate bugffer overflow.

Signed-off-by: Vitaly Lubart <vitaly.lubart@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

wsman-xml-serialize: use right sscanf parameters

struct tm members are signed, so use %d instead of %u in sscanf

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

debug: account for null from strdup

Implement assignment operator explicitly because

provides only a shallow copy of the object.

openwsman: free right memory on error paths

Use soap_destroy to destroy soap object, not regular u_free.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: free data on error path

Destroy deserialized filter object if exiting early with error.
Free memory allocated for host object if session is not available.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

Remove recursion in data processing

There is a recursion between process_connection() ->
connection_desctructor(). This could potentially lead to infinite
recursion under some situations. Replace recursion with simple
iteration.

Remove all leading dots in request paths

In addition to removing all double dots in the request paths, we should
remove all leading dots. After parsing request, the path is prepended
with another . thus leading to a .. at head of a crafted request.

Synchronize CWD between debug mode and daemon

When running openwsman in foreground mode, the CWD is not changed as it
is in the daemon mode. This can have material effects on requested
paths.
Fix compilation with debug statements

openwsman: define windows client transport library

Build client transport library that use WinHTTP instead
of curl while building for Windows.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: avoid search of curl and pthreads on windows

Avoid search of curl and pthreads on Windows as these
libraries are not used in the Windows build

Signed-off-by: Alexander Usyskin <alexander.usyskin@intel.com>

openwsman: ignore check for ipv6 on windows

Windows compilers always have IPV6 headers available.
In addition the check used Linux headers path so it
has always fallen on Windows.
We enable the check only on non Windows platforms.

prep v2.6.10

Fix possible denial of service

CVE-2019-3833:
"Openwsman, versions up to and including 2.6.9, are vulnerable to
 infinite loop in process_connection() when parsing specially crafted
 HTTP requests. A remote, unauthenticated attacker can exploit this
 vulnerability by sending malicious HTTP request to cause denial of
 service to openwsman server."

Restrict shttpd.c component to WS-Management operations

the shttpd.c component provides a generic http(s) server, thereby
exposing a too larger attack surface for malicious requests.

CVE-2019-3816
"Openwsman, versions up to and including 2.6.9, are vulnerable to
 arbitrary file disclosure because the working directory of openwsmand
 daemon was set to root directory. A remote, unauthenticated attacker
 can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted HTTP
 request to openwsman server."
